original: Holmberg, Nils Hjalmar, liandsarki-varie, Vadstena, f. 7/7/04 i Maifeö av disp. Carl H. o. Ellily Wilhelmina Braun. G. 35 m. May Iris Isabella Borgström. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 22, fil. kand. 24, fil. ämb:ex. 25, fil. lic. 32 o. fil. dr 34, allt i Lund. Aman. v. landsark. i Lund 33, e. o. tj :man v. landsark. i Gbg 36, andre arkivarie där 39, arkivarie 43, länisiarikivarie v. länsark. i Visby 46, l!and’s!arkivarie v. ’landisarlkiv. i Vad-steriia sed. 47. Stud:resor i Dammark, Tyskliand, o. Franiknik^e. Skr.: Från Svea t. Frithio’fs siaga (3’3i), Medelklassen o. proletariatet (grad :avh. 34), Enskiftet i Malmöh. län (39), Hembygdsforskn. i landsarkiven (40), Oderhandeln, Preussen o. Sv. Pommern (41), Åmåls hist. (43), Ordn:-principer f. industriarkiv (45), Från Montezumas Tenochtitlan t. Viskafors (45), Lidköpings hist. t. 1860’ (46), Direktions- o. avdelningsarkiv (47), art. o. rec. i vetenskapl. tidskr. o. dagspressen, medarb. i Sv. Uppsl :bok.
translated: Holmberg, Nils Hjalmar, archivist, of Vadstena, born on July 7th, 1904 in Maifeö to deputy Carl H. and Ellily Wilhelmina Braun. Married May Iris Isabella Borgström in 1935. He graduated from high school in Malmö in 1922, received a Bachelor of Arts in 1924, passed his Master of Arts exam in 1925, obtained a PhD in 1934, all from Lund University. He was an assistant archivist at the National Archives in Lund in 1933, temporary clerk at the National Archives in Gothenburg in 1936, second archivist there in 1939, archivist in 1943, county archivist at the County Archives in Visby in 1946, and National Archives archivist in Vadstena since 1947. He went on study trips to Denmark, Germany, and France. He wrote "From Svea to Frithiof" (1931), "The Middle Class and the Proletariat" (thesis, 1934), "Land Consolidation in Malmö County" (1939), "Local History Research in the National Archives" (1940), "Trading with Oder, Prussia, and Swedish Pomerania" (1941), "The History of Åmål" (1943), "Organization Principles for Industrial Archives" (1945), "From Montezuma's Tenochtitlan to Viskafors" (1945), "The History of Lidköping up to 1860" (1946), "Management and Department Archives" (1947), and articles and reviews in scientific journals and newspapers. He collaborated on the Swedish Encyclopedia.
